data.title: Famous Mount Carmel College Bangalore Alumni
data.meta_description: List of famous alumni from Mount Carmel College Bangalore, with photos when available. Prominent graduates from Mount Carmel College Bangalore include ...
data.text:
Anushka Sharma (pronounced [əˈnʊʂkaː ˈʃərmaː]; born 1 May 1988) is an Indian actress and film producer who works in Hindi films. One of the most popular and highest-paid actresses in India, she has received several awards, including a Filmfare Award, and was featured by Forbes Asia in their 30 Under 30 list of 2018. Born in Ayodhya and raised in Bangalore, Sharma had her first modelling assignment for the fashion designer Wendell Rodricks in 2007 and later moved to Mumbai to pursue a full-time career as a model. She made her acting debut opposite Shah Rukh Khan in the highly successful romantic film Rab Ne Bana Di Jodi (2008), which earned her a Filmfare Award for Best Actress nomination. She rose to prominence with starring roles in Yash Raj Films' romances Band Baaja Baaraat (2010) and Jab Tak Hai Jaan (2012); the latter, in which she played an aspiring filmmaker, won her a Best Supporting Actress award at Filmfare. Sharma went on to earn praise and several acting nominations for playing a woman troubled by criminals in the 2015 crime thriller NH10, which also marked her production debut, a dancer in the 2015 comedy-drama Dil Dhadakne Do, and a free-spirited woman in the 2016 romantic drama Ae Dil Hai Mushkil. Sharma's highest-grossing releases came with the sports drama Sultan (2016), and Rajkumar Hirani's religious satire PK (2014) and biopic Sanju (2018); all three rank among the highest-grossing Indian films. In addition to acting in films, Sharma is the ambassador for multiple brands and products and has designed her own line of clothing for women, named Nush. She supports various charities and causes, including gender equality and animal rights, and is the co-founder of the production company Clean Slate Films. Sharma is married to the cricketer Virat Kohli.

Deepika Padukone, a towering figure in the Indian film industry, has etched her name in the annals of global cinema with her extraordinary performances and magnetic screen presence. Born on January 5, 1986, in Copenhagen, Denmark, she was raised in Bangalore, India, where her prowess in badminton reflected the sporting legacy of her father, Prakash Padukone, an internationally acclaimed badminton player. Despite her early inclination towards sports, Deepika was drawn to the performing arts, a passion that led her to drop out of her pre-university education at Mount Carmel College, Bangalore, and enroll in Anupam Kher's acting school in Mumbai. Padukone's career trajectory took a sharp upward turn when she made her Bollywood debut in the 2007 blockbuster Om Shanti Om, starring opposite Shah Rukh Khan. Her portrayal of dual roles won her the Filmfare Award for Best Female Debut, kickstarting an illustrious career that would see her delivering numerous critically acclaimed performances. From playing the headstrong Meera in Love Aaj Kal to portraying the challenging role of a depression-stricken character in Piku, Padukone has demonstrated a knack for embodying diverse characters, earning her a reputation as one of Bollywood's most versatile actresses. Away from the camera, Padukone is known for her philanthropic endeavors, particularly in the realm of mental health. After publicly disclosing her battle with depression in 2014, she founded the Live Love Laugh Foundation to raise awareness about mental health issues in India. Her efforts in this area have garnered international recognition, leading TIME magazine to include her in their list of 100 most influential people in the world in 2018. Throughout her journey, Deepika Padukone has remained a symbol of resilience and determination, inspiring millions with her on-screen performances and off-screen initiatives.

Anushka Shetty, born as Sweety Shetty on November 7, 1981, is a distinguished Indian actress and model who primarily works in Telugu and Tamil films. Hailing from Mangalore, Karnataka, her journey to stardom is marked by her dedication and talent. She earned a Bachelor's degree in Computer Applications before training in yoga under renowned instructor Bharat Thakur, laying the foundation for her entry into the world of showbiz. Her yoga teaching career took a turn towards acting when she was discovered by director Puri Jagannadh, which led her to make her acting debut in 2005 with the Telugu film Super. Shetty's career in the film industry spans over 15 years, during which she has appeared in a variety of roles that showcase her versatility as an actress. Her role in the historical drama Arundhati, where she played a queen and a modern-day woman, won her the Filmfare Award for Best Actress - Telugu. However, it was her portrayal of princess Devasena in S.S. Rajamouli's epic saga Baahubali that shot her to international fame. The series, which also marked her first collaboration with Prabhas, became one of India's highest-grossing films, cementing her status as one of the leading actresses in Indian cinema. Offscreen, Shetty is known for her advocacy work, particularly in issues related to animal welfare and education. She is an ambassador for several charities and non-profit organizations, utilizing her platform and influence to bring about positive change. Despite her towering professional achievements, Shetty remains firmly grounded. Her work ethic, courage in choosing unconventional roles, and unwavering commitment to social causes have made her a beloved figure among fans and critics alike.

Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw (born 23 March 1953) is an Indian billionaire entrepreneur. She is the chairperson and managing director of Biocon Limited, a biotechnology company based in Bangalore, India and the chairperson of Indian Institute of Management, Bangalore. In 2014, she was awarded the Othmer Gold Medal for outstanding contributions to the progress of science and chemistry. She is on the Financial Times’ top 50 women in business list. In 2015, she was listed as the 85th most powerful woman in the world by Forbes. She again featured on the list - the most powerful women in the world - in 2016 and 2017 at 77th and 71st positions respectively.

The Indian name Mohandas is a patronymic, not a family name; thus, the person should be referred to by her given name, "Mamta".Mamta Mohandas is an Indian film actress and playback singer who predominantly works in Malayalam films along with Tamil and Telugu productions. She has won several accolades including two Filmfare Awards South, for Best Female Playback Singer in Telugu in 2006 and for Best Actress in Malayalam in 2010 and also Kerala State Film Awards for Best Actress in 2010.
